str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Rebecca, wife of the patriarch Isaac. Of Hebrew origin; Rebecca, the wife of Isaac.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From keimai; a couch; by extension, cohabitation; by implication, the male sperm.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.
